instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Anyone more familiar with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>? Trying to figure if is a board or parts problem, don’t have any donors to test at this moment.

Takes a little longer to boot, and no mouse or keyboard detected. One or two times, mouse worked, but it froze and powered off.

Did some measurements and all rails looks ok!
Should I buy a keyboard/mouse flex first?

Does It take longer to boot without mouse/keyboard?

I’m doing some research on how this machines works, but any thoughts to share would be appreciated!
Tks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Bad flex or bad trackpad are common on these. Trackpad has sensor in it and when it is missing board will run slow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Got it, just bought a Flex to try on it first! Get back when arrive.
